Further Up the Creek is a 1958 British comedy film written and directed by Val Guest and starring David Tomlinson, Frankie Howerd, Shirley Eaton, Thora Hird, Desmond Llewelyn and Lionel Jeffries.[1] It served as a follow up to Up the Creek, with Sellers not reprising his role because it clashed with the filming of The Mouse That Roared.[2] Frankie Howerd was drafted in to replace him.






Plot[edit]

Navy frigate the "Aristotle" is sold to a Middle Eastern power, and against regulations the ship's bos'n tries to make a profit by selling tickets to passengers seeking a luxury cruise. When the Captain discovers what is going on, he attempts to straighten things out.[3]
